isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - CAMSHAFT POSITION (CMP) SENSOR - SIGNAL FUNCTIONS

svcproc.title: SIGNAL FUNCTIONS
svcproc.para: The CMP (Camshaft Position) sensor is a Hall Effect type sensor that generates a digital frequency as windows on the timing disk pass through its magnetic field. The frequency of the windows passing by the sensor as well as the width of selected windows allows the ECM to detect engine speed and position.
Engine Speed - Is determined by counting 24 windows on the timing sensor disk each camshaft revolution.
Fuel Timing Control - The position of cylinder #1 is determined by distinguishing a narrow vane on the camshaft timing sensor disk.
Engine Mode Selection - Allows the ECM to discern when the engine is in the off, crank or run mode.
Injection Control Pressure - Engine speed is one of the controlling variables in the calculation of desired injection control pressure.
Exhaust Back Pressure - Exhaust Back Pressure control is a function of engine speed and load.
Fuel Quantity Control/Torque Limiting - Engine torque and fuel is controlled and is dependent on engine speed. Fuel quantity is determined by engine speed.
